meanings.sent1: The fastuous man walked into the room with a proud look on his face.
meanings.sent2: She always acted fastuous around others, thinking she was better than everyone else.
meanings.sent3: Despite his fastuous attitude, he tripped over his own feet and fell flat on his face.
meanings.sent4: Her fastuous behavior made her isolated from those who valued humility.
meanings.sent5: The fastuous king demanded everyone bow before him wherever he went.

meanings.sent1: The fastuous dress she wore to the party sparkled with sequins and glitter.
meanings.sent2: The fastuous car turned heads as it drove down the street with its shiny exterior.
meanings.sent3: Her fastuous jewelry collection was the envy of all her friends.
meanings.sent4: The fastuous decorations at the event made it feel like a royal celebration.
meanings.sent5: The fastuous mansion stood out among the modest houses in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: Characterized by excessive pride or vanity
meanings.sent1: His fastuous attitude made it difficult for others to approach him.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her fastuous behavior, always talking about her own achievements.
meanings.sent3: Despite his fastuous nature, he secretly doubted his own abilities.
meanings.sent4: The fastuous actress refused to take on any roles that she deemed beneath her.
meanings.sent5: The fastuous peacock strutted around, showing off its colorful feathers to anyone who would look.
